title: How To Deal With Trust Issues In Relationships
summary: There are some instances where you should pay attention to your red flags. Certain things may indicate that you’re dealing with a manipulative or abusive partner. Don’t rush things and fix everything at once just leads to more stress and problems rather than solutions. It takes time and effort to build a healthy relationship and trust takes time, too. Let your partner know what you need from them, such as an agreement on what type of relationship you two are in, the expectations you have of the relationship, and anything else that may be concerning you.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you first start dating someone, trust probably isn\u2019t the biggest issue on your mind. You\u2019re getting to know this person and trying to figure out if there might be a potential future with them or not. However, once you get into a relationship with this person and things get more serious, trust can very quickly become an issue.
Even if you don\u2019t trust someone right away, that doesn\u2019t mean the trust issues don\u2019t come up later on. It may take time for them to make you feel uneasy or distrustful of your partner. But it also could be something that crops up almost immediately \u2013 especially if you meet them in a place like a nightclub, bar or other place where people tend to hookup without much thought as to who they\u2019re hooking up with! This article will offer some tips on how to deal with these trust issues in relationships and help resolve any problems from arising in the first place.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Ignore Red Flags"),mdx("p",null,"Just because you\u2019re dating someone new and you\u2019re unsure if you trust them, it doesn\u2019t mean you need to call off the entire relationship. However, there are some instances where you should definitely be paying attention to your red flags and paying attention to your instincts. Certain things may indicate that you\u2019re dealing with a manipulative or abusive partner, and you need to be aware of those things and know when you need to get out. If you\u2019re ever in a situation where you feel unsafe, you should leave as soon as possible. If you\u2019re in a relationship with someone and you feel like you\u2019re being controlled or aren\u2019t allowed to have any friends or interests outside of the relationship, that\u2019s a huge red flag."),mdx("h2",null,"You Can\u2019t Fix Everything At Once"),mdx("p",null,"One of the biggest mistakes people make when they start dating someone new is trying to fix every single trust issue at once. You may want to trust your partner right away, but you may also want them to trust you right away, too. However, you can\u2019t expect everything to fall into place right away. It takes time and effort to build a healthy relationship and trust takes time, too. It\u2019s okay to start off more slowly, with more boundaries and limitations, until you two can build up a stronger foundation together. Trying to rush things and fix everything at once just leads to more stress and problems rather than solutions."),mdx("h2",null,"Communicate Your Needs And Concerns"),mdx("p",null,"While you don\u2019t want to try to fix everything at once, you also don\u2019t want to ignore your needs and concerns, either. Let your partner know what you need from them, such as an agreement on what type of relationship you two are in, the expectations you have of the relationship, and anything else that may be concerning you. If you let those things out in the open, it can help you feel better about the relationship and help your partner feel more secure and safe, too. It can also help you both figure out what needs to be changed and what boundaries and limitations need to be adjusted as the relationship progresses. This will also help avoid trust issues from arising as the relationship moves forward."),mdx("h2",null,"It Takes Time To Build Trust"),mdx("p",null,"Like we mentioned above, trust takes time. It\u2019s not something that can happen overnight or even within a few weeks. It takes months, sometimes even years, to build trust. So, if you\u2019re dating someone and you feel like the trust issues are getting in the way of the relationship, don\u2019t panic. Instead, try to take a step back and give the relationship more time to grow and develop. Once you\u2019ve both been able to show your trust and have been able to prove that your words are genuine, the trust issues should start to resolve themselves and the relationship will become much stronger because of it."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"When you first start dating someone, trust probably isn\u2019t the biggest issue on your mind. You\u2019re getting to know this person and trying to figure out if there might be a potential future with them or not. However, once you get into a relationship with this person and things get more serious, trust can very quickly become an issue."),mdx("p",null,"You can\u2019t ignore trust issues, but you also don\u2019t want to try to fix everything at once. It takes time to build trust and you need to let your partner know what you need and want from them. Once you two have been able to establish a stronger foundation together, the trust issues should start to resolve themselves and your relationship will become much stronger because of it."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Out of a Style Rut

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The risk of falling into a style rut is something we all have to deal with from time to time. It happens to even the most confident and daring of people, so you\u2019re certainly not alone if you feel like your style is stagnating and you can\u2019t think of anything new or exciting to wear. Whether it\u2019s because you haven\u2019t found a new piece of clothing that excites you in months, or because you just don\u2019t know what to wear after wearing variations on the same theme for several weeks in a row, everyone gets stuck in a rut now and again. Thankfully there are ways to get out of it and discover a new lease on your personal style once again."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Tips for Sticking to Your New Year's Resolutions

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"New Year\u2019s resolutions are like a clean slate for the coming year. What you do with that opportunity is up to you. Maybe you resolve to eat healthier, exercise more or reduce stress and anxiety. Maybe you decide to learn a new skill, read more books, help others or travel more. Or maybe your resolution is to do something completely different \u2014 like learn a language, stop procrastinating or read the complete works of Shakespeare. The possibilities are endless, but sticking to those resolutions can be challenging. The key is establishing habits that will last all 365 days of the year and not just one crazy day in January. It takes small but deliberate changes in everyday life that add up over time and become second nature. Here are 10 easy tips for sticking to your New Year\u2019s resolutions:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Your Hobbies

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you love something, it feels like there\u2019s not enough time in the day to do everything you want to do. But at the same time, when you don\u2019t have anything that fills your days with joy and meaning, it feels like there are not enough hours in a week. Many people struggle with finding time for their hobbies. They either feel too busy or believe that they simply don\u2019t have the opportunities to pursue something they enjoy. This feeling is understandable\u2014because most people lead incredibly busy lives. Work, school, family, friends, and other obligations take up a lot of time and energy. So how can you carve out some time for your hobbies? It might seem impossible right now\u2014but trust us, it\u2019s possible! Even if your schedule feels full beyond measure right now, there are always little cracks of space that can grow and expand into larger windows of opportunity."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Make Your Mornings Easier

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You know those people who seem to get out of bed with ease every morning? You know, the people that you see on Instagram and wonder how they\u2019re so happy so early in the day? Well, we hate to break it to you but those people have their own set of problems. Getting up after a long night is hard for them too; the only difference is that their solutions work.
These people have their own rituals and habits when it comes to waking up in the morning. If these folks can do it then why can\u2019t we? It\u2019s because some of us are too comfortable, which means we need to shake things up! Do you want to be one of those people who gets out of bed with ease and has a productive day ahead of them? In this blog post, we\u2019ll tell you 5 ways you can make your mornings easier.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How the Pandemic Is Changing the Way We Work

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Time is money, as the saying goes. And when you\u2019re grappling with pandemic disease and a global outbreak, time spent at work has a whole different set of implications.
Pandemic flu strains have decimated human populations since the first recorded pandemic in 541 AD. Over the centuries, outbreaks have been frequent enough to instill fear in even the most stoic among us.
Today we face another pandemic threat with the potential to be even more devastating than those which came before it. A highly virulent strain of influenza A virus known as influenza pandemia has begun spreading rapidly throughout much of the world.
In many ways, today\u2019s workplace is very different from that of a century ago. Technology has advanced; office structures are more open and collaborative; and workers are expected to demonstrate self-motivation and flexibility in order to thrive in an ever-changing workplace environment.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Beat the Winter Blues

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The winter blues is a mood disorder that can affect anyone, not just people from northern regions. Symptoms of the winter blues are essentially SAD (seasonal affective disorder) brought on by the shorter days and colder temperatures of winter. If you find yourself feeling blue during the colder months but don\u2019t necessarily have a reason to be, you might have the winter blues. The good news is that you can combat this feeling with a little help from your friends and some lifestyle changes.
Whether you have or have had the winter blues in the past, there are ways to boost your spirits when those long, dreary days of January creep up on you like an old friend you don\u2019t want to see again. Here are some ways to beat those pesky winter blues and get back to your happy self!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to save Money as a College Student
5 Tips for Eating Healthy on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you trying to eat healthier but find that healthy foods are expensive? Are you trying to make a good meal last for several days and not just one? Are you struggling to find affordable, healthy options near your home or work? If so, you\u2019re not alone. Eating healthy can be expensive and challenging. The cost of healthy food has gone up while the cost of unhealthy food has gone down. But this doesn\u2019t mean that eating healthy is impossible; it just means we all need to get a little bit more creative.
Eating well on a budget can be challenging, but it isn\u2019t impossible. Making smart choices about what you buy as well as how you cook your food can make a big difference in how much money you spend on food each month and how healthy your diet is at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Cut down on Screen Time
How to Deal with Envy in Relationships

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Being in a new relationship is exciting and often feels like a whirlwind. You spend time getting to know each other and spending time together as much as possible. But things can change once you enter a committed relationship or get married. Stressors from work, family, friends and other responsibilities may arise, putting stress on your relationship. This is when green-eyed monster envy creeps in and can have a negative impact on your partner.
There are many different types of relationships: friendships, casual dating or serious partners. Regardless of what type of relationships you have with another person, envy probably won\u2019t be far behind if they are important to you. Envy is one of the seven deadly sins for good reason. When we experience envy in a relationship it creates distrust, resentment and can ultimately end things prematurely before they even really begin. However, there are ways to deal with this feeling so that it doesn\u2019t get the better of you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
